docs.snippet: APPOINT/ Names 2 Officers Lance Primis, advertising director of The New York Times, and John M. O'Brien, the newspaper's controller, have been elected vice presidents of The Times, it was announced yesterday.   Mr. Primis, 34 years old, has been a...
docs.lead_paragraph: APPOINT/ Names 2 Officers Lance Primis, advertising director of The New York Times, and John M. O'Brien, the newspaper's controller, have been elected vice presidents of The Times, it was announced yesterday. Mr. Primis, 34 years old, has been advertising director of The Times since December 1979.

docs.snippet: In his long critical essay in the Modern Masters series, Jonathan Miller wrote of Marshall McLuhan's peculiar style. McLuhan, according to Dr. Miller, offered his dictums ''not as his privately owned opinions, but as orphan data sent back to earth...
docs.lead_paragraph: In his long critical essay in the Modern Masters series, Jonathan Miller wrote of Marshall McLuhan's peculiar style. McLuhan, according to Dr. Miller, offered his dictums ''not as his privately owned opinions, but as orphan data sent back to earth, as it were, from an unmanned space probe.'' ''He likes to see himself, not as an author, but as a publicly subsidized payload of sensitive instruments that records information irrespective of personal values.'' Certainly that was how he appeared to a shocked and intrigued literary world in the 1960's, in books that attacked the very idea of books, as if he were a blameless guru through whom the spirit of the electromagnetic spectrum - the spirit of ''haptic harmony'' and ''tribal wholeness'' and ''synesthesia'' - spoke in puns and gnomic riddles.

headline.kicker: HE WAS PROPHET OF GROOVINESS WHO GALVANIZED A GENERATION

docs.snippet: Governor Carey yesterday commuted the minimum sentences of 16 state prisoners, including Dollree Mapp, whose 1961 conviction in Ohio on obscenity charges had been overturned by the United States Supreme Court.   Mrs. Mapp, 47 years old, was convic...
docs.lead_paragraph: Governor Carey yesterday commuted the minimum sentences of 16 state prisoners, including Dollree Mapp, whose 1961 conviction in Ohio on obscenity charges had been overturned by the United States Supreme Court. Mrs. Mapp, 47 years old, was convicted in New York in 1971 of drug possession and has been serving a sentence of 20 years to life.

headline.main: 16 PRISONERS' SENTENCES ARE COMMUTED BY CAREY

docs.snippet: The Government index designed to forecast future economic trends rose significantly in November, the Commerce Department reported today, indicating that the weakness forecast by many economists is still not in sight.   The 1.2 percent increase in ...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Government index designed to forecast future economic trends rose significantly in November, the Commerce Department reported today, indicating that the weakness forecast by many economists is still not in sight. The 1.2 percent increase in the index of leading indicators - the sixth consecutive monthly rise - was viewed as confirmation that the economy was continuing to perform more strongly than the analysts expected. Although Government and private economists said that they still expected a weakening early in 1981, the addition of this latest statistic to a variety of similarly encouraging figures released in recent days made them less certain of their forecasts. Wonder 'About the Odds' ''It does make you wonder a little more about the odds we put on a decline in activity in the first quarter of next year,'' said Albert H. Cox Jr., president of Merrill Lynch Economics.
docs.byline: By STEVEN RATTNER, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: Robert L. Vesco, the fugitive American financier, has left his home here and his whereabouts is unknown, officials of the Ministry of Home Affairs said today.   Officers who arrived at Mr. Vesco's home on Providence Island this afternoon to serve ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Robert L. Vesco, the fugitive American financier, has left his home here and his whereabouts is unknown, officials of the Ministry of Home Affairs said today. Officers who arrived at Mr. Vesco's home on Providence Island this afternoon to serve him with a deportation order were told that he and his family left Nassau yesterday, according to Ken Heinrich of the Bahamas News Bureau. It was not immediately known whether Mr. Vesco had gone elsewhere in the Bahamas or had left the country. Mr. Vesco's boat, the Patricia, was tied up at his dock.

headline.main: VESCO VANISHES AT THE DEADLINE FOR DEPORTATION

docs.snippet: * Citibank N.A. has named William T. Comfort Jr. and Gerard B.  Finneran senior vice presidents.   * Donaldson Company, a Minneapolis-based manufacturer of engine air cleaners and mufflers, has appointed William G. Van Dyke vice president and cont...
docs.lead_paragraph: * Citibank N.A. has named William T. Comfort Jr. and Gerard B. Finneran senior vice presidents. * Donaldson Company, a Minneapolis-based manufacturer of engine air cleaners and mufflers, has appointed William G. Van Dyke vice president and controller, and Raymond F. Vodovnik vice president-law and secretary.

docs.snippet: The City Stores Company, operator of the W.&J. Sloane furniture stores, said it had filed its proposed plan of rearrangement with the bankruptcy court.   The company has been operating under Chapter 11 of the Bankruptcy Act since July 1979, and ho...
docs.lead_paragraph: The City Stores Company, operator of the W.&J. Sloane furniture stores, said it had filed its proposed plan of rearrangement with the bankruptcy court. The company has been operating under Chapter 11 of the Bankruptcy Act since July 1979, and hopes its rearrangement can be completed by the end of March. Under the plan, general unsecured creditors would receive cash payments of 35 percent of their claims, payable in installments by Jan. 2, 1985; an aggregate of 350,000 shares of City Stores common stock upon confirmation of the plan by the court, and 10 percent of City Stores' net profit for a seven-year period.

docs.snippet: Irvin F. Westheimer, who was inspired to form the Big Brothers organization when he saw a ragged boy and his dog rummaging through trash for food 77 years ago, died yesterday at the age of 101 years.   Mr. Westheimer's ambition and business knowle...
docs.lead_paragraph: Irvin F. Westheimer, who was inspired to form the Big Brothers organization when he saw a ragged boy and his dog rummaging through trash for food 77 years ago, died yesterday at the age of 101 years. Mr. Westheimer's ambition and business knowledge led him through a successful career as a whisky salesman, banker, stockbroker and head of an investment concern, but he said that he was proudest of founding the organization devoted to providing friendship to fatherless boys. Born Sept. 19, 1879 in Newark, N.J., Mr. Westheimer moved with his family a short time later to St. Joseph, Mo. He joined his father's business, the Westheimer Distillery, in 1901 as a salesman and opened an office in downtown Cincinnati.

headline.main: IRVIN F. WESTHEIMER, 101, FOUNDER OF BIG BROTHERS AT START OF CENTURY

docs.snippet: ''This afternoon your time of challenge and promise begins.'' - Ella T. Grasso to William A. O'Neill, her successor as Governor of Connecticut. (22:3.)
docs.lead_paragraph: ''This afternoon your time of challenge and promise begins.'' - Ella T. Grasso to William A. O'Neill, her successor as Governor of Connecticut. (22:3.)

docs.snippet: A. Cement or mastic can be used to put ceiling tile up over a painted surface, but only if the old paint is adhering firmly. If the paint has started to let loose, or if it lets loose later on, it will simply take the cement and tile off with it. ...
docs.lead_paragraph: A. Cement or mastic can be used to put ceiling tile up over a painted surface, but only if the old paint is adhering firmly. If the paint has started to let loose, or if it lets loose later on, it will simply take the cement and tile off with it. That is why you must scrape off paint that is loose or peeling or both. But you do not have to remove old paint that is adhering firmly. If in doubt, however, get the paint off.

headline.main: Q. I am putting ceiling tile up in one of my bedrooms, using a mastic cement recommended by the manufacturer. In order to prepare the ceiling for the cement and tile I started to scrape off some of the loose paint that had been starting to chip. Most of this is coming off without too much difficulty, but it is a slow process. Can you tell me if I have to remove all of the old paint, or is there some kind of size or sealer I can apply that will insure that I am cementing to a solid surface? -J.K., Philadelphia
